result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason L Barber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $300.00 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office in a payment plan of $25.00 per month beginning 3/1/16 and due on the 1st of each month thereafter until paid in full.  Failure to pay may result in warrant.
$200.00 DNA surcharge to be included in the payment plan of $25.00 per month beginning 3/1/16 and due on the 1st of each month thereafter until paid in full.  Failure to pay may result in warrant.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason L Barber

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jason L Barber in court with attorney Dan Firkus appearing specially.  Daniel Joseph Tolan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  KJB- Clerk. 348pm Def- Plea of G to Ct 1. CT accepts plea, finds G, enters JOC. 

SENTENCING: $500 fine- includes $200 DNA surcharge. PP of $25/mo  beg 3/1/16 and 1st of em thereafter. 4:00pm adj.
Report in support of probable cause for arrest. Request for criminal complaint

Not to have contact with: The Straight 8.   Not to commit any new crimes.  Defendant shall give written notice to the Clerk of this Court within 48 hours of any changes of address or telephone number.  Must appear at all future court appearances.  Not to possess or consume alcohol.  Subject to testing to determine compliance upon reasonable suspicion.

Defendant Jason L Barber in court, with attorney Brian Thomas Smestad appearing specially.  Defendant Jason L Barber in custody.  Daniel Joseph Tolan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  KJB- Clerk. 108pm Def wants to represent himself. Just moved to Amery- on Hwy 46, unsure of new address.  CT- can represent self for purposes of bond. Def to update address by noon on 11/23/15. Def to consider counsel; can call SPD to discuss more. bond cont. 1:15pm adj.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
